intro: Fimbristylis campylophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaved flat sedge, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in wet or seasonally wet habitats, such as marshes, swamps, and along the edges of water bodies. The plant has slender, grass-like leaves that are often slightly curved, and it produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in dense spikes. It is native to parts of Australia and is adapted to thrive in environments with high moisture levels. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
